name: 1/3 Investigator/Martyr
description: The 1/3 Profile combines the conscious need to investigate and build a solid foundation (Line 1) with the unconscious process of learning through trial and error (Line 3). This creates a person who researches deeply but ultimately learns most through direct experience.
lifeTheme: Building secure foundations through investigation and experiential discovery
gifts: Deep capacity for both research AND direct experience
Builds solid foundations through what actually works
Practical wisdom gained through investigation and trial
Resilience combined with thorough understanding
Can verify research through real-world testing
challenges: Tension between need for security and chaotic experiences
May feel destabilized by the trial and error process
Can over-research to avoid experiential learning
May judge themselves harshly for 'mistakes'
Inner conflict between knowing and discovering
relationshipStyle: Needs partners who understand both their investigative nature and their experimental life path. May have relationships that serve as learning experiences.
careerGuidance: Excel in fields that combine research with hands-on application. Often become experts through both study AND practical experience.
practicalGuidance: Honor both aspects: research to build your foundation, but know that your deepest learning comes through direct experience. Your 'mistakes' are actually verifying or disproving your research. Trust both processes.

name: 1/4 Investigator/Opportunist
description: The 1/4 Profile combines the conscious drive to investigate and establish secure foundations (Line 1) with the unconscious need to externalize through networks and relationships (Line 4). These are researchers who share their knowledge through their community.
lifeTheme: Building foundations of knowledge and sharing them through networks
gifts: Deep knowledge that benefits their network
Natural ability to teach what they've researched
Opportunities come through sharing expertise
Provides stable foundation for others
Influence through genuine knowledge
challenges: May hesitate to share until they feel 'expert enough'
Dependency on network for opportunities
Can become isolated in research mode
Tension between solitary study and social sharing
May over-rely on relationships for security
relationshipStyle: Friendships and close connections are essential. Partners are often found through their network. They teach and share knowledge within relationships.
careerGuidance: Thrive as educators, consultants, or experts who work through personal networks. Opportunities come through who they know.
practicalGuidance: Research deeply, then share through your network. Your knowledge is meant to be externalized and to benefit others. Cultivate relationships where you can teach and influence. Trust that opportunities will come through your connections.

name: 2/4 Hermit/Opportunist
description: The 2/4 Profile combines the conscious need for alone time and natural talents (Line 2) with the unconscious networking and relationship orientation (Line 4). These individuals have natural gifts that their network calls forth and helps them share.
lifeTheme: Natural talents called out and shared through close networks
gifts: Natural talents that others recognize and call forth
Strong network supports and shares their gifts
Selective engagement preserves authenticity
Opportunities flow through genuine friendships
Can influence others through natural abilities
challenges: Tension between hermit needs and network demands
May resist being called out for their gifts
Dependency on others to recognize their talents
Can hide gifts from even close friends
Balance between alone time and relationship maintenance
relationshipStyle: Need partners who respect their alone time while also being part of their intimate network. Close friends are essential but limited in number.
careerGuidance: Natural talents often become careers when called out by the right people. Work through close connections rather than cold networking.
practicalGuidance: Honor your need for solitude while maintaining your important friendships. Wait for your network to call you out for opportunities. Your talents are real—let others help you see and share them.

name: 2/5 Hermit/Heretic
description: The 2/5 Profile combines the conscious need for solitude and natural talents (Line 2) with the unconscious projection field and universalizing capacity (Line 5). These individuals have natural gifts that others project savior expectations onto.
lifeTheme: Natural talents that can provide practical solutions for the collective
gifts: Natural talents that can solve collective problems
Attractive projection field draws opportunities
Can universalize personal gifts for wider benefit
Solitude develops unique perspective
Charisma combined with authentic ability
challenges: Heavy projection expectations from strangers
Tension between hermit needs and savior projections
Reputation vulnerable when projections aren't met
May hide to avoid projection field
Paranoia about others' expectations
relationshipStyle: May attract partners who project savior expectations. Need relationships that honor both their solitary nature and their impact potential.
careerGuidance: Natural talents can become vehicles for providing practical solutions. Must manage expectations and protect reputation.
practicalGuidance: Honor your hermit needs—develop your talents in solitude. Be selective about which projections you engage with. When you do step out, offer practical solutions. Protect your reputation by not over-promising.

name: 3/5 Martyr/Heretic
description: The 3/5 Profile combines the conscious trial and error process (Line 3) with the unconscious projection field (Line 5). These are experiential learners whose discoveries can become practical solutions for the collective. They learn through experience and are expected to save others.
lifeTheme: Learning through experience to provide practical solutions for others
gifts: Wisdom gained through direct experience
Can transform personal trials into collective solutions
Resilience combined with influence
Practical knowledge that actually works
Charismatic despite (or because of) their journey
challenges: Trial and error combined with heavy projections
Reputation can suffer from experimental nature
Others may judge their 'mistakes'
Pressure to be a savior while still learning
Can feel like perpetual testing ground
relationshipStyle: Relationships often serve as learning experiences. Partners may project savior expectations. Bonds made and broken as part of the journey.
careerGuidance: Career often involves transformation and providing solutions based on personal experience. May change directions multiple times.
practicalGuidance: Embrace your experimental nature—your trials become the wisdom others need. Manage expectations carefully. Share solutions that you've actually tested. Your reputation grows through authentic, practical wisdom.

name: 3/6 Martyr/Role Model
description: The 3/6 Profile combines the conscious trial and error process (Line 3) with the unconscious three-part life journey toward role model status (Line 6). The first 30 years are intensely experimental, followed by observation, then embodied wisdom.
lifeTheme: Learning through experience to become a wise role model
gifts: Deep experiential wisdom earned through trials
Eventual objectivity and leadership
Authentic role model based on lived experience
Trustworthy because they've 'been there'
Transformation from chaos to wisdom
challenges: Intense trial and error, especially first 30 years
May feel like they'll never 'arrive'
Double experimental process can be exhausting
Long journey to role model status
May be impatient for the third phase
relationshipStyle: Early relationships often experimental. May need time on the 'roof' to gain perspective. Later relationships more stable and wise.
careerGuidance: Career path often unconventional, especially early on. True calling may not emerge until after the observation period.
practicalGuidance: Trust your long process. The first phase is meant to be experimental—don't judge yourself. The observation period brings perspective. When you step into role model, you'll have unmatched authenticity because you've lived it.

name: 4/6 Opportunist/Role Model
description: The 4/6 Profile combines the conscious network orientation (Line 4) with the unconscious three-part life journey (Line 6). Opportunities come through relationships throughout life, while the background process moves toward becoming a trusted role model.
lifeTheme: Influence through networks, becoming a wise role model over time
gifts: Strong network that grows over lifetime
Eventual role model status brings trust
Opportunities flow through connections at every phase
Can influence and guide their community
Combines relationship skills with wisdom
challenges: First 30 years include trial and error (Line 6 process)
Dependency on network while also needing roof time
May struggle with observation period isolation
Balancing network engagement with three-part process
Patience required for role model emergence
relationshipStyle: Friendships essential throughout life. May experience relationship trials in first phase. Becomes a trusted guide in relationships later.
careerGuidance: Career opportunities come through network at every stage. Later becomes a role model and mentor within their professional community.
practicalGuidance: Cultivate your network through all phases of life. Trust the three-part process happening in the background. Your connections will recognize and support your role model emergence.

name: 4/1 Opportunist/Investigator
description: The 4/1 Profile combines the conscious network orientation (Line 4) with the unconscious need for foundation and investigation (Line 1). These individuals share through their network while being unconsciously driven to build solid foundations of knowledge.
lifeTheme: Sharing knowledge through networks with a foundation of deep expertise
gifts: Solid foundation of knowledge shared through network
Authority status earned through genuine expertise
Stable and reliable for their connections
Can teach and influence from secure base
Opportunities come through demonstrated knowledge
challenges: Very fixed foundation can resist change
May struggle when network challenges their knowledge
Can become rigid in their expertise
Dependency on network combined with need for security
May over-research before sharing
relationshipStyle: Friendships provide opportunities. Partners value their stability and expertise. May be very fixed in relationship patterns.
careerGuidance: Become an authority in their field through deep study. Share expertise through their professional network. Very stable career path once established.
practicalGuidance: Build your foundation of knowledge—it's your security. Share through your network from a place of genuine expertise. Your stability and reliability are valued. Be open to updating your foundation when evidence demands it.

name: 5/1 Heretic/Investigator
description: The 5/1 Profile combines the conscious projection field and universalizing capacity (Line 5) with the unconscious need for investigation and secure foundation (Line 1). These individuals provide practical solutions backed by solid research.
lifeTheme: Providing practical solutions grounded in thorough investigation
gifts: Solutions backed by genuine expertise
Charisma grounded in real knowledge
Can meet projections with substance
Universal applications based on solid foundation
Reputation supported by actual research
challenges: Projection field creates high expectations
May never feel 'researched enough' to help
Tension between savior role and insecurity
Paranoia about being 'found out'
Can hide behind research to avoid projections
relationshipStyle: Others project savior expectations. Partners may rely heavily on their expertise. Need relationships that see beyond the projection.
careerGuidance: Called to provide solutions in their area of expertise. Reputation depends on genuine knowledge. Can become influential authorities.
practicalGuidance: Let your research support your solutions. You can meet projections because you've done the homework. Don't hide behind investigation—your knowledge is meant to help others. Manage expectations while standing in your expertise.

name: 5/2 Heretic/Hermit
description: The 5/2 Profile combines the conscious projection field (Line 5) with the unconscious natural talents and hermit needs (Line 2). These individuals have natural gifts that others project savior expectations onto, yet they need solitude to restore.
lifeTheme: Natural talents meeting collective expectations while honoring hermit needs
gifts: Natural talents that can solve problems
Charisma combined with genuine ability
Solitude develops unique perspectives
Can provide practical solutions from innate gifts
Selective engagement preserves authenticity
challenges: Heavy projections while needing to withdraw
Others may not respect hermit needs
May not recognize their own problem-solving gifts
Reputation dependent on meeting expectations
Can feel pulled between hiding and saving
relationshipStyle: Need partners who respect solitude while understanding the projection field. May resist relationship demands that pull them from hermit time.
careerGuidance: Natural gifts often become the basis for providing solutions. Need career flexibility for hermit time. Called out for their talents.
practicalGuidance: Honor your hermit needs—you need solitude to restore. Your natural talents can meet projections, but be selective. Others will call you out when it's time to engage. Protect your alone time fiercely.

name: 6/2 Role Model/Hermit
description: The 6/2 Profile combines the conscious three-part life journey toward role model (Line 6) with the unconscious natural talents and hermit orientation (Line 2). The three phases unfold while natural gifts develop in the background.
lifeTheme: Becoming a wise role model while honoring natural talents and need for solitude
gifts: Natural talents that mature through the three phases
Authentic role model with innate abilities
Solitude develops unique wisdom
Eventually called out to share accumulated gifts
Trust earned through lived experience and natural talent
challenges: Trial and error phase while having hermit needs
May resist being called out, even for role model duties
Three-part process can feel isolating
May not recognize their own natural gifts
Balancing observation period with hermit tendency
relationshipStyle: Early relationships experimental. Need for solitude throughout. Later relationships honor their role model status and natural gifts.
careerGuidance: Natural talents develop through the three phases. Eventually called out to share wisdom. Need career flexibility for hermit time.
practicalGuidance: Trust your three-part process while honoring your hermit needs. Your natural gifts are developing through every phase. When called out to be a role model, your authentic talents will shine.

name: 6/3 Role Model/Martyr
description: The 6/3 Profile combines the conscious three-part life journey (Line 6) with the unconscious trial and error process (Line 3). This creates a double experimental process—intensely experiential in the first 30 years, eventually leading to profound wisdom.
lifeTheme: Intense experiential learning leading to authentic role model wisdom
gifts: Profound wisdom earned through intense experience
Most authentic role model—they've truly 'been there'
Resilience developed through double trial process
Eventually gains objectivity about their journey
Can guide others through what they've survived
challenges: First 30 years can feel extremely chaotic
Double experimental process is exhausting
May feel they'll never gain stability
Bonds constantly made and broken
Long wait for wisdom and recognition
relationshipStyle: Early relationships intensely experimental. Bonds made and broken as part of learning. Later relationships stable and wise.
careerGuidance: Career path unconventional and changeable, especially early. True role model status emerges from professional experience and trials.
practicalGuidance: Your first 30 years are meant to be intensely experimental—don't judge yourself. The observation period brings perspective on all you've experienced. When you step into role model status, no one will doubt your authenticity—you've earned it.
